name: James Fields
text: Quiet Place & Personable Staff. I must admit. They have a few drainage issues on the front 9. Holes 3, 4 and 5 are problematic. However, the course is nice and the green fees are reasonable. Great Hot Dogs 🌭 at the Club House!!!

name: Brenden Knight
text: Quiet and friendly but very poorly kept course. Fairways are like people’s backyards, very hard ground terrible tee boxes. The greens aren’t too bad, overall 3 stars. $28.00 for 9 holes isn’t too bad.

name: Charles Hughuley
text: Hidden meadows was much better than I thought. I hadn't been since spring of 2019, so I didnt know what to expect. I was pleasantly surprised,  especially at the way they are caring for the greens. They are in good shape, well worth the money!!! June 2020

name: Alan Kirkman
text: I live in Tuscaloosa and this is by far the best course for the price. The staff is great, the greens aren't bad. Always well maintained. The front 9 you can easily lose a ball of its hit off the fairway. Really thick rough. Back 9 make up for it with really nice holes. We play here every chance we get.

name: David Todd
text: Like playing in a bad yard lawn. Price of $32 is way too much for the poor quality of the course.

name: Tamara Emerson
text: This was a wonderful day spent with my husband and 6 year old grandson..Beautiful scenery perfect weather & a good lunch! Can’t wait to visit again♥️

name: Eric LaFoy
text: Decent course. Had some challenging holes. Grass was a little high in areas.

name: Emmitt Carden
text: WARNING**** Hidden Meadows Golf Course? More like Hidden Golf Course.  Not well maintained. You'll lose your ball in the fairways---fairways look like the rough of other golf courses. The first hole we skipped because it was completely dirt. Not a course for golfers who play regularly.

name: Tim Burns
text: Really enjoyed my round here. The price seems right on for what you get ($25 w/cart). It is not the best maintained course, but the conditions did not alter my round in any way. I am a five handicapper and thought this was one of the more clever designed courses ive played for the price. Very hilly with some blind tee shots.  A lot of the holes have hazards that if you hit driver you will be in trouble, so you really need to play smart. I hit mostly long irons and hybrids off the tee and had no trouble finding fairways and parring. If you want to just play a round for fun and not break your wallet, this course is a really good option.

name: Meghan McDaniel
text: Hidden Meadows is a challenging course with a great layout. The staff is friendly and helpful. A great way to spend your day!

name: jonathan kroeker
text: Good course with good potential. greens are not kept up well

name: Thomas Moat
text: Great golf course for the price!  Super affordable with a great staff that can cook a mean burger!

name: robby peele
text: Very poor quality. No tee times so it ends up getting way too backed up. Don't waste your time.

name: Karen Harrell
text: Hidden Meadows is a decent course for the price and is good when you just wanna go out and play a round.

name: Joshua Snead
text: Very friendly staff, nice course. It was a pleasure.

name: Daniel Martin
text: Decent course for the price but wear your old golf shoes because it is usually wet and muddy everywhere. Greens are slow and bumpy but you get what you pay for.

name: John Bedson
text: First timers. Affordable, with a very nice staff.

name: Billy Helmandollar
text: Ok course but needs some updated and needed maintenance.

name: Connor Sanford
text: Great course and staff

name: Collin Gilstrap
text: Open on the weekend, the google hours are wrong.

name: Courtney Jackson
text: I really enjoy playing here. The front 9 is very challenging. Overall, this course is very peaceful with playable greens. Nice driving range. Debra in the clubhouse is very friendly and helpful.

name: Michael Bass
text: ARAB, AL!! This is an amazing course. Tucked away in a secluded area off a major highway (231). The atmosphere of staff were great. Cart girls and workers were great. We took a group of 12 this year and played Friday, Saturday, and Sunday! ( 90 holes) We stayed at the lake house and enjoyed every second of the time here!

resp.text: Thanks so much for your kind review!  It was a pleasure hosting your group.  We hope you come back soon!

name: Melissa Cothran
text: What a beautiful course! Tree-line fairways, foothill views, a dam built over 100 years ago, a natural 40 ft waterfall . . . plus great golf!  The staff is friendly, and I recommend their great Southern gourmet burger.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We know we'll see you soon!

name: Gary Dwyer
text: The course is a gem. It's in great condition and absolutely beautiful place to play. You will love it.

resp.text: Thank you so much for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Chris Smiddy
text: Beautiful and amazing course!!!! Driving range could've been better since we had to hit off the mats only but there wasn't any rubber tees. There weren't any signs or pictures for the holes posted on the course. They wI'll give you a map upon request, so do so cause it's really detailed and amazing. Definitely look forward to playing again!!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back again soon!

name: Louis Tominack
text: Nice layout.  Greens are a bit slow.  Overall nice place to play.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back and play again soon!

name: Kevin Bacon
text: Nice "mountain" course! Pay attention to the book that they give you on insights to each hole!!  Greens in ok shape, t-boxes need to be cut and weeded...

resp.text: Thank you for your review!  We are currently working on many course improvements.  You probably saw that a number of trees were removed and new sod laid in their place.  We hope you come back again when our grounds crew has caught up on all the special projects and has the course in top shape.

name: Jamie Clark
text: Very fun and challenging course to play.  A course that everyone can play by choosing a set of tees that match your skill level.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back again soon!'

name: Dwight Washington
text: The course is in great shape. They changed the layout, what was the front is now the back. Greens were quick, fairways were plush. Give it a try, I think you will enjoy it.

resp.text: Thanks for your kind words.  We hope you come back soon!

name: Will Irby
text: Just in awful condition. The greens are awful, with dead spots and fungus issues. The bunkers are unplayable and full of rocks, the fairways are even in bad shape in several places. We paid $57 to play and it was a waste of money. For $25 I would play it, but it is at least 2x overpriced, if not a bit more. If you are in the area you are far better off going to an RTJ course or driving further to play a different course.

name: Marcia B
text: Love Love this gated golf community.  Like living at a resort with golf, fishing, pool, tennis and the the people are much more than neighbors.  They are friends of the truest sense.  The golf is outstanding and the many community activities are so much fun.  This area is a gem! Also great lodging at the lake house.

name: jay johnston
text: Could be and may have once been a nice course, but the greens were infested with cancer and the sand bunkers were just shy of being unplayable.  Bare lies in fairway and around the greens. This course needs a lot of maintenance before it will be worth $60/18 holes.

name: Andy Forrester
text: Great golf course. Greens are in great condition and the views are incredible.  Friendly staff, good value.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Jeff Szarek
text:
This course came recommended by some people at work. We set up a tee time the day before for Saturday. We traveled about 40 mins to the course. It was right off the highway into a gated golf community. Right from the start we were greeted by the staff. Upon entering the clubhouse, I was amazed at the initial set up of the course. My co-worker had to rent some clubs, at which they were very accommodating by giving him a brand new set of Nike Vapors. I had the Coverts 2.0 from the previous year and was impressed at the rentals they provided. We went to the driving range and then the putting green and we were off. Long story short, the course was AWESOME and the view was even better. We found ourselves stopping to take pictures and taking in the view (Which I rarely do on course). What I thought was to be a 6 hr round (because of our relax play at each hole) was a little over 4 hrs. This course is in my TOP 5 best courses I've played in my life, (I've played in the range of 50-60 different courses). I would recommend this course to anyone who enjoys a challenge, but also a forgiving course layout. The scenic views are something out of a movie which as to the relaxation of the game of golf. If you are ever in the area, you have to check out this course.

A big Thank You to the staff there at Cherokee Ridge who were some of the top notch personnel a course can have. Jonathan Watts, a Graduate of the Golf Academy of America Orlando, did not disappoint to the customer service and knowledge one would find at that school.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: R C
text: The clubhouse has excellent food and the course views are breathtaking!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Larry Bryan
text: The sand traps fill with water, almost no yardage markers, no idea where the holes are on the greens, some greens are in bad shape, and they allow groups of 7 to play. Nice layout but not worth the price.

name: Dick Bourget
text: Playing was wonderful

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you play again soon!

name: Screaming Weasel
text: Golf course is equally challenging and gorgeous. Top notch.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: brian jones
text: Several of the greens were bad, always considered this one of the best courses around but it isn’t anymore. Really disappointed.

name: JAMMIE LYNN
text: This course is way over priced for the condition it's in. I paid $61 to play on burnt greens on nearly every hole.  Edges of greens was really bad,  big sand holes you couldn't hit through.  Fairways wa in ok condition.  Most of all, they put out maybe 3 jugs, but only 1 jug had water in it, and that was on the 3rd hole.  We stayed thirsty!! We went  inside to buy a drink, well they had some water made up , but the water made up was also lukewarm.  This course maybe wasn't worth $18 much less $61. Will not be back.  Worst course played in many years of playing.

name: John Woodfin
text: Beautiful golf course and very good food at the clubhouse.

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Jon Jones
text: Great course and in great condition!

resp.text: Thank you for your kind review!  We hope you come back soon!

name: Devin Strickland
text: Nice course. Will be back

name: Buddy Flowers
text: This is a nice 9 hole course . Not wide open so you have to actually PLAY golf . Not just whack it and go hit it again . Not crazy about people practicing on the course itself while you are playing , but I understand there is no practice range for this . So if you can handle picking your ball out of another guy's shag bag it's a nice course to play . I'll play it again for sure .

name: Kevin Bingham
text: Surprisingly good considering it is inside a Golf Clubhouse. I definitely recommend the desserts

name: Shirley Wilson
text:
U

I went there to eat dinner at Merida on the  green. Which was very good. Thank you and GOD.

name: Sara & Mike Cantin
text: Fun course with some tricky spots. Got to keep em straight

name: Trip Overstreet
text: Ate at Meridas, as all ways great

name: Lee Carlisle
text: Great people nice course.

name: reid garris
text: Needs more carts. Always out

name: C Sim
text: Peaceful course, and nice people. Wear a collared shirt, and you'll have a great time. Cart path needs a lot of work, but other than that 4/5

name: Justin Watford
text: I've played worse but for $40 I expected more. Extremely friendly and professional staff (I give them and the clubhouse 5 stars) The course needs a lot of work. Greens were in terrible shape and sand traps were basically clay pits with grass growing. There is hardly any signage throughout the course which can be a pain to navigate if you've never been. I heard nothing but good things about this course but once we got past the first hole it was in rough shape.

name: Dan G
text: Inexpensive and a decent course. Friendly staff and great wings.

name: George Yinger
text: Wow not what expected shame it has potential but needs lots of work.

name: Ivan San Inocencio
text: Best course in my opinion love it

name: Dave N
text:
Poorly maintained in desperate need of work on the grounds
The greens are quite bad and the tre boxes are dried out mud flats
The layout is decent but no care has been taken to bring the course up to par .

name: Jesse Hollingsworth
text: Very pretty course with great scenery. The greens here are some of the toughest greens I have ever experienced. If you are up for a challenge, this is a neat course to play.

name: Kim Melton
text: We had my niece's baby shower at Cumberland today and it was super nice. The place has amazing views and Veronica runs the place top notch!

name: r b
text: My first time there and I was impressed..Veronica is a very good manager...she is on top of the flow of players..

name: Brian Tolzman
text: Veronica was great!  The course was in rough shape. They did have bad weather however don't think that affected the conditions though.

resp.text: Not a correct assessment.  Condition and layout, one of the best in the area at this price point.

name: jullie hallman
text: Beautiful

name: Tangy Bodie
text: My husband and 3 others drive over 1 hr to play this course. When they got there a lady was working the club house. They informed her that they had reserved a tee time at 12:30. She was soooo nasty to them. She threw her hand up to cut them off and informed them that there were no carts available for 30-40 mins. The guys were ok with this since they would hit the driving range up in the meantime. It was her holier than thou attitude that made them mad. The owner was contacted and he defended her saying she sometimes comes off as rude, he did however go speak to the men and offered them a Gatorade as compensation... Yes will deff not be back! But they did say the course was nice.

resp.text: The real story of this review is that Tangy Bodie whatever her name may be, wasn't even at the golf course.   This is more of a story of how she can attempt to extract extreme compensation for the threat of a bad review.  From the moment speaking with Alexis on the phone the conversation quickly became "what kind of compensation will you give me??"  Meaning she wanted me to refund over $ 160.00 in greens fees because of her threats of a poor review.   I went out to the course and spoke to the gentlemen about the incident.  They were delayed only 5 minutes from their tee time.  My worker could have had a cooler head dealing with customers, but an apology was made and the men appeared to be happy that I looked into the situation. I offered to buy them a round of beers as a friendly gesture.   I am more than willing to accept a one star review than cower to a person trying to extort money in lieu of a bad review.   Cumberland Lake GC is one of the finest golf courses in Birmingham at its price point.  And, we also have some very fine individuals working behind the counter.  Please judge for yourself.

name: Mike Hamner
text: Really nice course, fairways and greens were very playable, challenging layout. Will definitely want to play it again.

name: Michael Dennis
text: Love it such a nice place to hang out and supper friendly  staff!!!

name: Jackie Aronhalt
text: My husband golfed 2 rounds here and loved it! I enjoyed the huge (amazingly clean) pool, food, drinks and view. Awesome!

name: Daniel Banks
text: Great little course. Played it while in Birmingham on business. Greens were a little slow, but rolled smooth. Fantastic layout. Will play again next time in town.

name: Jane Aronhalt
text: New ownership has made amazing turn around. Beautiful course. Love the views. Looking forward to booking a group event.

name: David SMith
text: Course is looking really good! They seem to be making a lot of improvements. Best deal in town at $23 on Tuesdays!

name: Brandon Shirah
text: Love the layout. Course was bought by a group of people and since then they have let the course go a little bit. New new groundskeeper to take pride in the course.

name: Homer Marlowe
text: By far in the best shape it has ever been in thanks to a  new grounds keeper  sent from heaven an new managers that are looking out for the members a great place to jone

name: Parker Cantrell
text: 19th hole has some of the sweetest people around. Worth the trip

name: Lavador Sizemore
text: Beautiful golf course, i worked at this golf course back in 1996 and 97 alot of good memories!

name: Terry Crane
text: Greens are fast. Course in good shape

name: Byron Dixon
text: Very friendly staff. Great rates.

name: Harrison Jones
text: Nice place.

name: Jenny Foster
text: Completely disheartened that my son and husband were called liars and asked to leave because at 4:00 in the afternoon played two holes out of order so that the one other couple there could play in peace. The old man working was very rude.  Perhaps in his zest to close he forgot that customers pay the bills. We won’t be back.

name: Jacob Pinkerton
text: Very unfriendly staff. I used to look the other way when you could play for less than $25, but now they are too expensive for the service and quality of the course they provide. I highly recommend you go to either Montevallo Golf Club or Frank House Municipal Golf Course. Their prices are the same as here AND it's a proper course, unlike the putt-putt course that is Magnolia Meadows. Not to mention, you won't be yelled at by the staff for simply enjoying your afternoon.

name: Jason Turnbow
text: We had an absolutely horrible experience! The staff that operates this course is the most unprofessional and inconsiderate set of individuals I have ever encountered. To go along with their general incompetence, this course is in extremely rough shape. It looked like the greens hasn’t been cut in over a week and often had puddles of mud on the edges. With so many golf courses in the Birmingham metro area, there is zero reason to step foot in this establishment.

name: Barbara Dollar
text: This place is beautiful! I went to a birthday there and the club house is an excellent venue for parties and family reunions. It's family owned and they are  very friendly and welcoming! I'll be back! 😊👍

name: Ryan VanSickle
text: Great place to play if you like made up rules about golf cart etiquette, an older man that shouldn't be talking to the public, and a course that closes whenever he says it closes. I have played this course several times previously, but it seems the "fun and welcoming" atmosphere is no more. We play about once a week at courses all over and have never seen anything like our last round here. Terrible. We will take our business elsewhere and not worry about an old man smoking a cigarette driving up and talking down to us as if we legitimately did anything wrong. For a course that looks like it's struggling on rounds per day, they might want to revisit their employee interaction.

name: Jackie Sausley
text: This is an easier course, good for a beginner, intermediate, or seniors. We've enjoyed playing here.

name: Clark Thompson
text: Wonderful place and really nice staff

name: Brian Hardenbergh
text: Absolutely the worst experience I’ve ever had. Paid for 18. Course is open until 7:30. At 7:05 an old man cam out and said we need to stop playing and bring the cart back so he can wash it. We continued to play and he was throwing a fit. When we pulled in at 7:25, he told us when he tells us to bring our carts in he means it. We asked if the course closes at 7:30 and said yea but he wanted to have all the carts washed before then. Horrible service and will never be back.

name: Kenneth Smitherman
text: Great golf course...much more challenging than people think!

name: Kerry Holeton
text:
Nice, tight course
Wish I would have been able to control my shots better.

name: Nick Dale
text: Great course!  Short very short par 68 but fun and in great condition. Awesome greens actual fairways!  Would of gave it 5 stars but length is to short par 4 160? But my new place to play.

name: JImmy Blankenship
text: This course was in terrible shape. I drove 1-1/2 hrs to meet my two sons there to play on 2/24/18 and i was so disappointed, especially since we asked how the course was and was told to believe it was in better shape than we were actually told. If they would have just been honest instead of trying to decieve me just to get my $29.00. I recall only 2 greens that even had grass in them, they were all covered in sand. The only green you could see was #1 and #18 and they only had about 30% grass. We have played there several times so we expected a honest answer on what shape the course was in. I never plan nor do my sons ever plan to spend money there again.

name: Barron Polk
text: Great fast 18 hole course

name: Savannah Cingoranelli
text: Great short course! Had a lot of fun on the green. Great friendly staff too.

name: phil white
text: Great local golf course and doesn’t break the bank

name: Eddie Jerrell
text: Nice executive course. Friendly staff. Great place for a quick round and to work on your game.

name: Greg Cook
text: The most fun eclectic courses you will ever play Very nice staff. Greens in good shape this summer..

name: Lance Moore
text: I visited for the first time today.  The course is affordable, well maintained, and beautiful.  The green fees on the weekend is $27 w/tax and cart too.  The course is located in Columbiana about a 35-45 minute drive from Birmingham.  I will visit this course again.

name: Laverne Gunn
text: Nice layout greens in terrible shape hard to enjoy with no grass on the greens not worth the price

name: Martha Wilson
text: My husband works very hard to make Magnolia Meadows beautiful!!! Thank you Tim Wilson for all you do.

name: Scott Howell
text: Great short course.   Only 25 bucks.

name: Jenny Jackson
text: If I could give it a no star I would.   The greens are awful with crust all over them.   Multiple fugues on the green and eaten up with weeds.   Never play there again.   Also it was 30 dollars

name: Paul Wren
text: Great people and fun place! Will be back tomorrow!

name: Jason Echols
text: Great prices and for me a challenging course.

name: Typsy Flacko
text: Great short course. Best course for beginners.

name: Mark Boles
text: Great family atmosphere the greens are OK ,good for the novice golfer

name: Kim “TLOML” Tinney
text: Pretty place

name: Chris Hughes
text: Can't fish the ponds

name: Charles Montgomery
text: Time of relaxing

name: David Price
text: Very nice short course.

name: stephen parks
text: Greens are horrible!! Hardly any grass on them. Looks like dead grass and mud mix

name: Jason Brough
text: Great fun!

name: Collin Pody
text: Decent course for the money

name: Robert Keeling
text: You owe it to yourself to look up this little Gem....it’s 5 star as in its one of the friendliest and fun place to golf not looking ratty or worn out the locals would never divulge this place....Biggest driving range in North Alabama 350 yards long 100yards wide.....WoW

name: Bud Beam
text: Best course I've ever played!  Dale and Sharon are great!!

name: brightchance1
text: Kinda off the beaten path. Nice course, narrow fairways, well kept grounds. Friendly staff. Nice restrooms.

name: Craig Vaughn
text: Great place to play and relax very hospitable will be back

name: Bryan Dixon
text: Great place to play golf and not expensive at all

name: Heath Williams
text: I love the staff.   The lady up front is an angel.  There are free hotdogs and chips at lunch.  Kids 15 and under play fee with an adult. The course is short and fun.  The fairways are good. There is an island green on a par 4. I am taking away 1 star for the furriest, slowest greens I have EVER played on!!!  It is absolutely unbelievable how slow they are!  I drove a green, and parred the hole🙄.  Part of that is my golf skills , but the other part is that I needed a 5 iron to get to the hole from the other side of the green.

name: GARY BLACKLOCK
text: Enjoyed my first visit to this course. Personnel were really friendly and helpful. Will definitely make another trip for another round soon.

name: Bryan Bell
text: This is a pretty challenging little course, especially the narrow back 9. It's very inexpensive. BUT...the greens are horrible! They definitely need to invest in green upgrades. If you're just looking for a cheap place to knock around a little white ball, this is the place for you.

name: Michael Edwards
text: Enjoyed playing at the course.

name: Michael Morgan
text: Competitively priced, friendly staff, very quiet course in the country. Bring bug spray, it’s next to a cattle farm. Front 9 is wide open, back 9 is tougher and there are some blind tee shots.

name: Thomas Silas
text: Enjoyed it. Good price and free hotdogs

name: Rick Holliday
text: Absolutely love this golf course can't  wait to go back you must go play it  ,back 9 lot easier than it looks you can hit 5or6 iron on most of holes you will be inside 150 yard mark, very friendly owners nice Pro Shop

name: David Norris
text: Cant beat it for the price. Great staff also

name: Roger Townd
text: Good course great people, can't beat it in my book ,

name: Scott Swain
text:
Love Willow Brook Golf Course💖
The owners and staff have always been exceptional in every way. Challenging play, and they're always "upgrading"!

name: alisha Dubois
text: Beautiful

name: Steve Gilbert
text: Certainly a great job on upgrades and maintenance. Also pricing is affordable for everyone. Great people great golf.

name: Ellie Childress
text: Our Church had our Golf tournament here and it's beautiful! Very friendly, family atmosphere.

name: Gary Priem
text: This course us not too bad for winter conditions. Greens are fast, fairways a little slow because of recent rain.

name: Paul V
text: Could be better... Greens fee is reasonable and nice folks

name: Bobby Wynn
text:
Great place great
people try it and see

name: J Galvin
text: Not bad for the price but the greens are a little on the dry side

name: Howard Harp
text: Great golf course for me

name: Gary Ledbetter
text: A great place to play golf with your family and friends

name: Adam Hunter
text: Whole courses  was in horrible condition.   Burned grass, hard pan everwhere.  Yardage signed were wrong on the tee boxes.  Oh and i have to mention the tee boxes are actually tee mounds so hard you brake your tee puting it in the ground.  Not worth a two hour drive.  Won't  be back.

name: Nick Swain
text: A beautiful diamond in the rough!

name: Rodger Kilgore
text: Great owners and just a lot of fun.

name: Justin Morgan
text: awesome... keep up the good work

name: James Ray Young
text: Beautiful course

name: Worm Bizzle
text: Loved it

name: Stan Hess
text: Nice course, it's fun

name: danny veal
text: Nice people enjoyed

name: Lorrie Scott
text: The people who run it are wonderful

name: Virginia Hames
text: Beautiful condo rental! Grounds are very well kept. Wonderful place to vacation

name: William Tucker
text: Awesome staff. Made the process super easy to apply and quick turn around on getting my lease started. Super clean and exciting place to live. Thanks Johnny Leigh for making it simple!!

name: T
text:
Lacking in professionalism, honesty, and dignity.
Interested only in oneself.  Fails to uphold promises, legally binding or not.
Overall, nightmare to reside

name: Jerry “Woo Club!!!” Johnson
text: Great course but make sure you bring extra balls you may need them. Staff was very friendly as well

name: Kennedy Ellison
text: We just moved in, and Johnnie Lea in the leasing office made the transition so easy. She has been attentive to our every question and need, and we had quite a lot of questions, but she was always patient with us. She made sure we had all the correct information, and that we were comfortable and moved in properly. The leasing office at my last apartment complex was less than desirable , so its very refreshing to know that we will be taken care of. I am very excited to reside here.

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful review!!

name: Samantha Perez-Martinez
text: I just moved in to One Club and absolutely love it! Johnnie Lea has been very helpful through the whole process of me moving from out of state! She is so friendly! I would definitely recommend One Club! The property is beautiful and my apartment is very spacious with lots of storage!

resp.text: Hi Samantha, we are happy that you chose ONE CLUB as your home. Thank you for such kinds words, we appreciate it!

name: Josie M.
text: One Club is just that. ONE Club- it has everything you need right here on property from Golf, Pickle Ball, Two Pools, a Sauna, the Fitness Center which overlooks the Golf Course, a Bark Park, a Playground, and a Game Room. The restaurant is amazing (be sure to try the Sand Trap Nachos!) and the bar staff make it such a fun atmosphere. The Pro Shop and golf course are outstanding and you won’t meet better people. If you are looking for a place to live, golf, eat, relax, or all all the above: this is the place for you.

resp.text: Thank you so much for the wonderful review, Josie.

name: Eric Gulley
text: Professional and courteous staff. Have a unit in a beautiful, quiet area and neighbors are great!

resp.text: We appreciate the 5 star review!

name: Arnold Uhlig
text: Staff was great Scott, and Deb food great and a tough one club coursr

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star rating, Arnold!

name: dawn simmions
text: I love ONE CLUB because it feels like I am living at a resort! All of the amenities I have longed for are at my fingertips. The pool is such a great way to beat the heat. Every weekend they have a new music performer at the pool area. The golf course has been transformed from brown fairways to luscious green grass to play golf on. This place is a hidden gem. The free coffee in the morning at the clubhouse is great. I am super excited for the full service restaurant to open up on the property!

name: Andy Eggleston
text: Staff does not wear masks in the pro shop. That is inexcusable and an immediate one star review. Masks work and should be mandatory. Also I didn’t make a putt all day even though I am a +1 handicap. My wife and I will NOT be coming back

resp.text: Your feedback is much appreciated. Our Pro Shop Staff is trying their best to maintain social distancing while servicing customers daily. If you would like to speak with our management team, please contact us at 844-ONE-CLUB.

name: Steve Carter
text: Had a great time at a wine tasting!!

name: Candace Palmertree
text: We moved to One Club two months ago and wish now we had made the move sooner. The staff is AMAZING and we have made so many great friends!  There are rules as it pertains to dress code on the golf course, as it should. If you aren't having a great experience, talk to the staff and give them a chance to turn it around! Kudos from Candace and Thomas

resp.text: Hi Candace, we are happy that you chose ONE CLUB as your home. Thank you for such kinds words, we appreciate it!

name: Karen Lambruschi
text: New owners care nothing about tenants, landscaping isn't being kept up, "improvements" are slow, awkward and lacking in respect to long term residents.

name: Mary Gilbert
text: This place is horrible! We had mold in our room and they just painted over it. We also booked a reservation for a room with a king bed. When we got there it was a thin, cheap, full sized bed. We stopped in to speak with a manager - they were not available. We left a message and never heard from them. When we stopped back we later in the week they said our stay was almost over and they would not do anything for us. They do not know anything about customer service. We will never book with this place again!

name: christopher parker
text: Great golf course and everyone that works there is nice. Took my son there we played 9 holes and it was his first time every playing and had a blast.

resp.text: Hi Christopher! We are happy to hear that you & your son enjoyed the course! We hope you visit again soon.

name: tw sanderson
text: Nice track 9 holes play it 2 time for 18 holes  target golf poke and a pitch had a good time

resp.text: Thank you for the wonderful review! So glad you enjoyed your round. Hope to see you again real soon!

name: Joshua Downey
text: There was blood on the bed sheets, holes in mattress.And my mom and aunt had to clean up, there was a couch with holes inside and there was roaches in the couch.

name: Cheryl Bloom
text: This is my second snowbird winter at One Club and have enjoyed the amenities. This year when we arrived, we didn’t see any of the same employees except for Alex in the Pro Shop, who we think the world of. Just yesterday, I found out she was let go!!  I felt sick. Other Employees had been let go also during our stay this winter!!  It seems these employees are replaced often. It’s so sad, especially during the Covid-19 times, they would be let go.  I’m leaving next week, with a sad feeling for these employees. This staff was great!! Made you want to come back. What is One Club thinking?

name: Alysa Krueger
text: We are in a national shut down and employers have laid everyone off, and we are laid off until at least May 1st according to the CDC and The President of the United States. But ONE CLUB, is making sure they get their rent on April 1st! So like 90% of Americans that are jobless, and if living here at the ONE CLUB, we will be expected to pay $100 FINE AND $10 for EVERYDAY ITS LATE! TO avoid the fines you need to provide Certified letters from your employer and other  verifications. Normally that wouldn't be an issue, but when your job is shut down there isn't ANYONE at work to Provide CERTIFIED letters. If it was just a email or letter needed that may be doable but not during a National Shut Down! They don't have the residence in mind nor are they being helpful. Among all that, we will continue to pay for our amenities even know they are closed, as they should be. As far as renting here. The grounds around all the buildings are horrible looking. Dead grass around each building, water valve boxes that have holes or are broken completely, doors that don't shut or open properly, dishwashers that are out of date and hardly  functional, paint bubbling and falling off the walls. Maintance try to fix things but don't have what they need to fix most of the work orders. The pool is nice but furniture around it are old and broken wood splinters and faded, the cabanas are couches that are old and worn out. This place is over priced and has fees upon fees that are due every month with rent. At $1568.00 and in a national crisis the ONE CLUB Doesn't have its residence in mind nor will they help to find a solution for their residents. Rent a different place if you have the option to do so.

name: John Lanier
text: 17/12 realy good course

resp.text: Thank you for the 5 star review, John!

name: Jacob Rymer
text: I was forced to buy a $40 polo for my girlfriend (who was only riding) to be in dress code to be able to play the course, which would have been fine if the rule was applied to everyone. While on the golf course, I noticed several other golfers and walkers out of the dress code that I was forced to follow. Then I was met at the 18th tee with the staff demanding the cart back, which was apparently late, even though there was no sign and no one told us there was a deadline. We hurried through the 18th and tried to return the cart. Then while unloading, I was met in the parking lot by a manager telling us if we can't have the cart back on time, that we wouldn't be welcomed back. I apologized about the cart and vented my frustrations about the dress code, and the staff was very hostile and unapologetic. The electronics in the cart stopped working on the back 9 holes (which is just the first 9 played again) and the course was overall not very good, with only one par 5 and very short par 4s. Take your money and play a better course with better management somewhere else.

name: Ashlyn Irons
text: Amazing staff. Amazing community. Leasing agents, especially Kathy make this place feel like home. Issues addressed quickly, great maintenance staff.

name: Anthony Morelli
text: My wife and I absolutely loved our stay ! Everyone was absolutely amazing and helpful !

resp.text: Hi Anthony. Thank you for visiting ONE CLUB and we are happy to hear that you & your wife enjoyed the stay!

name: Amy Ellison
text: My husband loves to play golf ⛳ at the only Arnold Palmer designed course around! You gotta check it out! Stop in the 45 bar for shrimp 🌮 tacos afterwards!

resp.text: Hi Amy! Thank you for the 5 star review. We are happy to hear that you had a great experience out on the course.

name: Rose Brauchler
text: Wow! Great place to live   if you want to invest the price x 1 b 1b $150.00 Hoas @ $450.00 but if you want to rent x 2b2b @ 1200.00 , Utilities $120.00 water $25.00

name: Jackie Jabour
text: ONE Club handled COVID well and balanced resident comfort and safety.

resp.text: Thank you for the kind words Jacquelyn!

name: Steve Gilliland
text: We golfed at One Club, the service that we received was point on!!!! The course was awesome, the lady in the pro shop treated us to the up most respect. Explained the course and sent us on our way for some excellent golf.

resp.text: Thanks for such a great review Steve! We hope you visit again to hit the course.

name: Joan Johns
text: Some reviewers here seem to be on the "friends and family" plan.  You know, employees who are having friends and family who don't live here write reviews!  Come on guys!  Like the employees writing reviews aren't fake enough!!!  All the fake reviews in the world won't change the way residents feel about the way we are treated.

resp.text: Hi Joan. Thank you again for the feedback. We have tried reaching out to you multiple times in replies to several other reviews you have left for us. Our management team would like to address and resolve any issues you may be having. Please contact our main office line at 844-ONE-CLUB.

name: Michelle Starkey
text: Christi Watkins and Kathy fisher are the leasing agents are amazing!! Very prompt!! Very nice answer all questions you have and very happy to shuttle you in the golf cart to show you around! Will work with you in every way possible!! Jaimey Fairey the manager is a amazing person inside and out !! Is there to help when needed!! Allways makes sure things are allways taking care of with the best people around!! The property is geogeous, it’s a must to experience!! A resort all in one !! Never have to leave !! Pool,bar, amenities galore!!!!!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the great review, Michelle!

name: B Price
text:
Came here to play golf 2 days in a row.

First day was excellent, minus there not being any Golf Pro / Associate in the office on my arrival (with a reserved tee time). Course seems well maintained and was practically empty of anyone playing.

Second day was a seperate story. I arrived 20 minutes before my tee time to check in and get my cart. 5 minutes before tee off they put a group of 4 out while I was playing solo. I went to the putting green to hit for a few minutes and let them play on, but as I was getting off the practice green another family of 4 headed out to tee off! I had a reserved solo tee time and had already been postponed 15 minutes while they were STILL letting people enter the course, completely disregarding my reservation.

Once finally able to tee off, I was held up waiting on groups at every hole. Probably the most frustrating thing about the whole experience was after 4 holes, waiting on families with children at each hole, I decided it was time to go get a rain check and leave. Once again, nobody in the pro shop to talk to. Didn't get my rain check or a refund.

Very frustrating, One Club has lost my business. Too many other fantastic courses in the area to waste your time here.

name: robby portugal
text: Great golf course and wonderful condo

resp.text: Hi Robby, thank you for the kind words! We hope you return to ONE CLUB in the near future.

name: Jere Jabour
text: Consistently fast and thourough response to maintenance requests.

resp.text: Thank you for the five star review!

name: Jordan
text: The one star is strictly for the “restaurant” at One Club. I understand it has only been open about a month, however, the service I received today was pitiful. I put in a to-go order and waited approximately 30 minutes for my meal. As I waited, I watched chaos. The “bartender” was all over the place. She could not remember a single drink or order that someone had placed. The service was inexperienced to say the least. She suggested next time we call our orders in ahead of time.... not exactly what you want a staff member telling customers. As I continued to wait, I heard her mention to someone of higher authority that we all have been waiting a while bc of the chef. Yes, you might benefit from adding another chef in the kitchen, but the food he put out was beautiful and very delicious. He was the only positive experience to my Chipotle patty melt and a side of fries. One Club- highly suggest reevaluating your staffs ability to do professional and timely service for the job description. Especially your bartenders.

resp.text: Hi Jordan. Thank you for the feedback and we apologize greatly for a delay in this response from us. We now have a wonderful, professional team at Bar 45 and have even added in exciting events such as Wine Tastings, Karaoke, BINGO, Bar Trivia and much more! We hope that you will stop by again in the near future to give us another try and to meet our new team.

name: kamola kamilova
text: The worst customer service, mean rude when you ask for the  OWNER's contact info knowing you doing the right thing they would warn you turning it to their attorney

name: Sally Files
text: I honestly loved it here when I first moved in  Dec. I do not feel that way anymore. It's gotten worse it seems over the year and I can not wait til my lease ends soon.

name: Julie Campbell
text: We love living here. After downsizing with our children graduating, marrying and moving away, it was a difficult move after living in our beach townhouse for years but moving here has helped our teenager adjust with all of the amenities. The Pro-Shop also has a grill that currently has a 100% rating from the Health Department. The food is great and the company is awesome. From the staff, owners, and visiting vacationers/snowbirds, we have really enjoyed living here. The only con is the pool is already closed and it is still warm outside. Pros:  Besides the huge pool, there is a hot tub, sauna, 2 tanning beds, golf and a huge work out room to keep you busy! Enjoy the cookies (snacks - Apples for fall) and apple cider or lemonade and coffee. The staff works really hard at making you feel at HOME :)

name: jacob montgomery
text: Absolutely love how gorgeous it is. Almost like you are living resort style. The office management is amazing and always positive!

name: samantha hatfield
text: Great place to live, great place to hang out!!

name: Todd Shannon
text: Kind of misleading saying it has 45 holes and then when you get there you have to play the same 9 hole course twice to get your 18.

resp.text: Hi, Todd. We apologize for the confusion. We do partner with another course to offer "The Best 45 Holes In Golf."  Please reach out to our Pro Shop at 251-968-3234 and we can better explain how it works. You can also visit us online at www.oneclubgulfshores.com/golf to learn more.  We hope to see you soon!

name: linda Linzy
text: Great place to gather!

resp.text: Thank you so much for the 5 star review, Linda!

name: Amy Marissa Childers
text: Everyone I’ve talked to tried to warn me about renting an apartment here but I did not heed the warnings and now I am in full on regret. Let’s start at the beginning where the leasing office told me that the gates would be functional in two weeks when I first signed a lease at the end of March. Not only do the gates never work, no security feature on this property works, anyone can drive onto property or walk into the pool or exercise room. I have a gate card that I have never had to use but I will bet if I lose it they will charge me for it.  The hot tub was chained off for months.  But what really takes the cake for me is the fact that after saying all of that about how poor the security is, I called the after hours maintenance to help me because I am a single woman locked out of my apartment (due to my own stupidity, I will admit) and I was told I would not be helped (despite acknowledging that there was probably a charge for such a call) because they would not go to the office and check to see if my lease matched my Id. And before anyone tries to say it’s unreasonable to ask, this was only Between 5:30 and 6 in the afternoon. *And* in order to make a maintenance request you have to log into a password secured resident portal so how in the world can it be justified that my identity could not be verified? Thanks to either a faulty company policy or an employee just not wanting to do his job, I had to spend money on a hotel room for the night.    And also, I was told my the office staff a few months ago that the rent was going up 200 dollars at the end of my lease so yeah, long term rent here at your own risk. I’m sure it is a great place to stay if you own your condo or are renting through a vacation management company. Also, I agree with other reviews, it is unreasonably noisy: DO NOT RENT A 1 BEDROOM IN FRONT OF THE ELEVATOR.

name: Deeanna Lonsdale
text: I had the opportunity to visit this property today.... May I say I am so impressed with the  NEW Management Company and they NEW OWNER. This is going to be the NEW "IT" place to live. I am looking forward to watching this Great Team of People grow this community.

name: J Yates
text:
Oh my god.

The rent increases, the silly amenities that no one asked for. (Looking at you volleyball court/ litter box)

Lived here 5 years. Since RAM properties took over, it's ridiculous. My rent has increased more than 15% in a single year, and that doesn't count the fees that they sneak in every time I renew my rent.

What the hell is an AMENITY fee?

WHY IS INTERNET $30 MORE EXPENSIVE?!!? It's no better than it was a year ago, and even though I don't use TV - you refuse to treat me like an adult capable of selecting my own cable package. $100 a month flushed down the toilet, even though I only want internet.

Screw this place. Don't live here.

resp.text: Thank you for the feedback. Our management team has changed since this review and we would like you to know that we are continuously working on improvements to our service and overall community!

name: Dylan Abker
text:
Management staff is absolute garbage.  They treat their tenants horribly, and act like any service you request is a terrible inconvenience to them.  I have never lived anywhere where the front office employees are so pompous.
Needless to say we will not be renewing our lease.

resp.text: Hi Saiyan. Thank you for your feedback. We are very sorry that your recent experience at ONE CLUB has not met your expectations. We strive to provide the best customer service to all of our residents and guests, and when we fall short of this we work to do everything we can to resolve the issue. Please stop by our office or call 844-ONE-CLUB and ask to speak with our management team so that we can ensure your experience here is a more pleasant one.

name: Nathan King
text: Claim to be pet friendly. Provided complete disclosure of travel plans.  Agreement upon contract terms and making payment in full upon said terms facility attempted to charge additional fees and acted as if full disclosure wasn't provided. Some other tenants were rude. Do not intend on staying here again in the future.

name: Christina Landrieu
text: Nice but the people that the front desk/office was very helpful when we needed them because a snake got in the apartment. The snake is still in the apartment somewhere. An it have a two year old kid. They don't even know if its poisonous.

name: Reggie Pulliam
text:
My girlfriend and I have been looking for a place to live in the area. We went through a showing with a guy who was leaving the company soon. He was as nice and professional and knowledgeable as could be. We enjoyed the showing and the location, so we wanted to lease an apartment.
We called in as instructed on the second of the month, and we were offered a move-in date on the 8th. We told them that was too soon and needed to push it back a couple of weeks. We all decided on the 23rd.

During those two weeks, my girlfriend and I made multiple attempts to contact the leasing agents and sign paperwork, such as the application or lease. Not one of these calls or emails were ever returned. Literally. Not one.

Eventually, the paperwork was ready on the 21st, we signed and moved in after scrambling to get the electricity, cable, and water turned on. We do not expect much out of apartment management companies, but they did not even achieve the minimum expectations.

We moved in on the 23rd. During the "walk-through", it was noticed that the garbage disposal was not in proper order, but they would be through to fix it "today".

After more than a week and a half, it is still broken.

The golfing, pool, tennis court, and neighbors are more than great. The management is awful. And the maintenance guys are incredibly friendly and knowledgeable.
Just wanted to vent.

name: Brian Papenfus
text: Fantastic

resp.text: We appreciate your 5 star rating! Thank you so much!

name: Melissa Copeland
text: Very nice. The grounds are kept clean. The golf course is in view no matter where you are located.

name: roy green
text: The management and staff in the rental office are the most disrespectful, rude and unprofessional group I have ever had the unpleasant experience dealing with.  The children in that office have no clue how to treat or deal with prospective guests.  On top of my experience with them I ran into a complete stranger at another rental property and she told me she had the same experience.  We both rented from another site.  Nice job children you lost two renters in one day.  Hope the owners give you a plaque for you non-customer service and costing them over 20k.  Oh on another note, look for a discrimination letter from my lawyer.

name: Missy W.
text:
The rent has gone up $250 for 2019. The owner must be a ticking time bomb trying to steal people's money. My husband just passed away and now I am having to find a new place to live. I feel like they are trying to kick people out. The rent is $1547 for a 3br. Going forward for the new lease and I have a parking lot view.  I have only lived here less than a year.
Very Distraught!!!

name: HDYLMN HDYLMN
text: unbelievably unprofessional and fees upon fees since this new group took over. safety has become a serious concern as well. we have seen no security presence whatsoever lately and OC apparently fired the company they were contracted with. the gates no longer close at midnight, sometimes much later or not at all.  Gulf Shores police department seem to be here a lot more often and we have found non-resident people dumpster diving in our trash area at 5AM. we also see people coming in the gates late night to DUMP their trash in our collection area! we came in very early last Mon morning from our out of town weekend to find a wrecker repossessing a car---who let him in without a security or police escort onto the property? these sorts of things used to never happen here before the bar opened and it was somehow decided not to close the gate until very late after events. a lot of weekdays it is open very late (or not closed at all) as well. this is NOT a gated community anymore and shouldn't be advertised as such.

name: Stephanie Gilmore
text: So...I live in what is now One Club in Gulf Shores. I currently have a 4ft dehumidifier in my living room and an industrial fan in each room due to their washer pouring water out. This is the THIRD time in a month. My dishwasher has not worked in OVER a month but I keep getting promised of a new one. Oh and now...the air conditioner is leaking from the vent in the ceiling. I’m so gone!  UPDATE: I got a new dishwasher and washer but they literally left with the air vent pouring water in my floor. When I called the office I was put on hold for 20 minutes. When I called back she made light of it and said she would "put another work order in". It is simply unacceptable and incompetent!

name: Avery Deal
text: It's a beautiful place to stay. The rooms are very nice and the atmosphere is wonderful. Close to everything we wanted to do!

name: Laurie Farris
text: This place is fantastic. I love the pool area and the views of the golf course are amazing.

name: Bob Lommel
text: Just went to club 45 to have a cocktail. Bar has no atmosphere, drinks were high and service was less than average

name: Philip Crouch
text: very nice tract....would like to know the slope and index for handicap?

name: Rick Kornis
text: The amenities are on par with other resorts in the area- nothing better or worse. However, the staff are not friendly; in fact, I question why they are in the hospitality business. This is an impression formed from not from just one incident, but many- unfortunately. I would rate this location 4 stars but for the management's horrendous attitude toward guests.  Instead, 1 star is being generous.

name: Courtney Oneal
text: Did not have a good experience.

name: Bravo Actual
text: I visit my parents there biannually.  I will say that their condo is beautiful the grounds are immaculate however I get reports constantly that lease keeps going up. And now the gulf is going to cost another $175 per month and your car rentals are going to be $10 for 9 holes this is ridiculous. They went there just for the fact of their golf course and the facilities. We were looking at buying a place just to vacation and to move to in the next several years. After hearing this I think it's in our best interest to look elsewhere we definitely don't want to place that is going to keep trying to nickel-and-dime us. But like I said it is a very beautiful place. And for the people that say the staff is rude I have never experienced that everyone has been very courteous and very professional.

name: Nick Lowe
text:
Super nice apartments but holy cow at the staff. Place is ran like a circus. Incompetent. 3 weeks I spent talking to these people and every single time they acted like they had no idea who I was. I will admit I got denied the first time because of a debt that was due to my ex wife. Took care of it THAT day. Was told I needed to bring the reciept where I paid the collection agency. I did. 45 mins later I get a call saying that’s not good enough and that I have to call the renters Buerau and get it off my record. I did. Had to fax them a copy of the receipt from collections agency. So we get approved but the office tells me that I have to pay a 500 dollar fee plus put down another 1100 dollar deposit then pay the first months rent which is an additional 1100. Keep in mind I’ve already paid 400 to run the application. So just to get in would be 3100 dollars. Mix that in with the fact that the First Lady I ever talked to had a death in the family (which I hate for her) but she doesn’t even transition us to another agent. So we’re bringing in copies of our social security cards, I.Ds, bank statements and places of employment, you know, everything that can be used to steal an identity, and NO ONE knew where our file was. This is 2 weeks into dealing with these people. So finally after literally calling and talking to EVERY LEASING CONSULTANT which had no idea where any of my information was, one lady finally said she would handle our file. This is on a Friday. I wait the weekend and call Monday. The lady no longer works there. What the hell....so I call twice Monday, because no one EVER CALLED ME BACK during the 3 weeks I was dealing with the place, and asked who was our leasing consultant because I don’t want all my bank statements and social security floating around their office AGAIN. The lady said she’d  take over our file......she tells us we’re approved we just have to pay 1600 deposit which imcludes an unexplained 500 dollar fee....after 3 weeks of jumping through hoops I gave up. Couldn’t handle the ignorance or the incompetence any more. Like I said very nice place. Would love to live there but not at the expense of being treated like a stray dog.

Side note; if one club attempts to contact me in resolving this issue it would be a waste of their time and even more of mine. I have no interest in being part of their community. I gave them MULTIPLE opportunities to act like a professional and do their jobs. They couldn’t meet the standard.

name: Dean watson
text: All I can Say is WOW, the Staff at One Club have really done a fantastic job in creating a Resort-Style atmosphere and lifestyle... We look forward to working with them every step of the way !

name: Curt Brewer
text: Upscale units. Grounds are well-kept! Pool is fun but is only 4 foot deep.

name: Davanna Clayton
text:
I moved out of state to come here. Before we decided to move we called the front office more than 20 times regarding numerous questions about costs and fees. They were always very nice and helpful but they did not even mention the other required "fees" to live here.. When we made the 6 hour drive to come up here is when they actually tell us our rent would not be what was discussed the past 20 times we called to verify. You HAVE to pay for cable with your rent which is $68 (not including $70 for them to install, and I hope you don't sign a 6 month lease bc then you would have to sign a year contract with the cable company because they don't offer 6 months, $10 for trash and $5 pest fee. That's 83$ extra per month that they forgot to tell me about until I drove 6 hours down here.. so now we will not have TV because I cannot afford to cancel the service but I still have to pay for the $68 every month with no TV.

I would also like to add:
When the landscapers came to cut grass they weedeated mud and it got slung it all over my car pretty bad. My fiance went to the office to see if anything could be done and all the lady said was, "What do you want me to do about it?" So unprofessional. If I was to say that at my job I would have been fired. I am honestly so glad my lease is up this place is a joke. They also have no clue who is in what apartment.. The last two times i've needed a copy of my lease they had down someone else's name for my apartment number. Then they stuck a paper in everyone's door wanting renters to fill out a paper with your name and general information that they should already have. I could write a book about this place.

name: Jane Levenson
text: I have to agree with the previous post.  I was warned multiple times not to move in here but I did it anyway.  In that amount of time my rent has gone up over 200 dollars a month, my cable has gone up (when I moved in basic cable was included, now you have to pay and if you want it on more than one set you have to rent a box for each additional set)  and we have been promised the gate would be repaired, which it hasn't.  We are charged for pest control every month, which I guess is to cover the outside of the building only as no one ever comes inside.  The only thing I can figure out is our rent went up to cover the cost of the office/club house remodel.  Very disappointed in this place.

name: Baker Dunaway
text: Was getting basic cable included in rent which was on the rental package. They now are charging witch meant they went up on the rent but just call it cable and internet charge that we are held hostage to because we have to buy from them. Two places are vacant in my building now and I know of 2 more next month and another in May. My lease is up in June after being here 4 years am soriously thinking I am leaving.

name: Kelly Everson
text: Noisy. Concerns have gone unanswered or completely unaddressed. Loads of children play around vehicles always, always unsupervised and feel no issue hitting and then climbing up on your vehicle with their frisbee, soccer ball, etc. Staff acts annoyed when you call and voice concern. There is no accountability for rules within the community.

name: Baker Dunaway
text: Was getting basic cable included in rent which was on the rental package. They now are charging witch meant they went up on the rent but just call it cable and internet charge that we are held hostage to because we have to buy from them. Two places are vacant in my building now and I know of 2 more next month and another in May. My lease is up in June after being here 4 years am soriously thinking I am leaving.

name: Road Block
text: Do yourself a favor. Don't move here. This is the Hotel California.

resp.text: We apologize that our community did not satisfy your expectations. We set a high standard for ourselves and are truly sorry to hear that standard was not met. Your happiness is our number one priority here at ONE CLUB. A member of our management team would be more than happy to speak with you and discuss any problems you may have experienced. Please contact us at 844-ONE-CLUB.

name: Davanna Clayton
text:
I moved out of state to come here. Before we decided to move we called the front office more than 20 times regarding numerous questions about costs and fees. They were always very nice and helpful but they did not even mention the other required "fees" to live here.. When we made the 6 hour drive to come up here is when they actually tell us our rent would not be what was discussed the past 20 times we called to verify. You HAVE to pay for cable with your rent which is $68 (not including $70 for them to install, and I hope you don't sign a 6 month lease bc then you would have to sign a year contract with the cable company because they don't offer 6 months, $10 for trash and $5 pest fee. That's 83$ extra per month that they forgot to tell me about until I drove 6 hours down here.. so now we will not have TV because I cannot afford to cancel the service but I still have to pay for the $68 every month with no TV.

I would also like to add:
When the landscapers came to cut grass they weedeated mud and it got slung it all over my car pretty bad. My fiance went to the office to see if anything could be done and all the lady said was, "What do you want me to do about it?" So unprofessional. If I was to say that at my job I would have been fired. I am honestly so glad my lease is up this place is a joke. They also have no clue who is in what apartment.. The last two times i've needed a copy of my lease they had down someone else's name for my apartment number. Then they stuck a paper in everyone's door wanting renters to fill out a paper with your name and general information that they should already have. I could write a book about this place.

name: Hailey Lewis
text: These condominiums have recently been sold. Due to this, it's like management no longer cares. The elevators are no longer as clean. The pool is gross and is hardly ever cleaned. The place is nice, but the people are also rude. Golf balls can fly all around and hit cars. Not to mention, my car has been keyed probably about twice. We complained to the front desk and they couldn't do anything, because they do not have any surveillance cameras.

name: Misha Patel
text: Its nice place but horrible service also after 2 people takes shower there is no hot water!!!! Horrible staf!! If you want a family friendly place to stay... This is defiantly not the place to live!

name: Tita magën
text: Do not rent. Or buy. Horrible corrupted staff JAIL type resort. They only nice to make you sign. If you buy the staff will treat you like crap no respect. If you complain the director will run her mouth and lie till no end to PROTECT HER SORRY EMPLOYEES.

name: sherry hoggle
text: Pool is beautiful and the food at the clubhouse is fantastic and a great value.. Condos are beautiful and spacious

name: Stephanie Wright
text: Wish I could give them  a negative one. Promised me a furnished unit only to find out that they had none available.

name: B W
text: Great little community.  Friendly staff and great amenities.

name: T Butler
text: Nice place to live. Very many amenities

name: James Bailey
text: Great place and pricing. only a couple of miles from the beach!

name: Cassandra Roberson
text:
Emeral Green's staff is not what a great company represents. Please take a moment and read my situation as it will hold truth to what happened to me. First, I Ioved my place and relunctantly was forced to vacate. I rented at Emerald Greens from Aug 2013 through Nov 2014.  I had no problems when I first got there as they (Blake, Stepanie, and the office manager),  were on top of everything but as I remained in place, upon my renewal, things took a drastic change. There are (3) issues I had with the managment and I'd like to share my true views with anyone wanting to rent from Emerald Greens.

I was told originally that the gym had 24 hour access, when in fact, it does not. I was never told the severity of how they (Blake especially), can just come into your home at leisure... for no apparent reason. I was not comfortable with this but they said you signed an agreement allowing us to enter your place at will.  Of course I signed this but never in a million years would I have thought someone would just come into the unit for no reason.

The reason that impact my move was their "questionable" pet restriction policy that I nor anyone else knew anything about.  Upon my move in 2013, Blake told me that the company has a breed restriction (no pit, basically the obvious aggresive breed dogs) and dogs could not weigh over 25 lbs. I never signed anything because I didn't have a pet at the time but I knew I'd get a puppy eventually.

I renewed my contact in July 2014. My daughter, whom is an Auburn Soccer player, gave my her 3 month old minature chiwhawah (under a pound) because she couldn't maintain her.  Since I'm alone, I took the puppy because base upon my understanding from Blake and my conversation when I moved it, we could have small dogs BUT HE NOR THE STAFF NEVER SAID THE DOG MUST BE OVER 12 MOS. I was going to the front to pay the pet deposit fee for having the puppy and the front management told me I was not allowed to have th puppy on the premises. I was immediately assessed a penality fee!  I was told to leave with the dog immediately or get evitcted within 5 days.  I also was told by Blake and the staff that I could place the dog into shelter unitl she reached a year old, and then bring her back onto the premises. Obviously, this was clearly about keeping a good paying customer.  I requested to speak with CEO/Housing Association, basically someone that could make a decision based upon the circumstances.  I was even willing to pay a differ fee to remain in place and keep the puppy. They refused to allow me to speak with anyone but themselves. They forced me out and told me I cannot stay with the puppy. At this point, I told them that I'd just leave. Remember, I just renewed my lease not even a week or so before.  I told them since I cannot stay, I will leave.  Blake told me you cannot leave, you must stay the 45 days and pay us and you will be assessed $2700 penality fee for breaking your renewed lease.  He also said you cannot just pay the rent, you must reside within the property with lights on and everything or I would be in violation. At the time, my neigbors told me they were coming in my condo even when I was not there everyday.  I was getting very scared and fearful because I am not from Alabama, I'm from Virginia, just moved down because of my college soccer player,.  I was very scared.

I hardly stayed there but had to pay the rent and now the penality has affected my credit.  I have never had this type of issue with a company in my life. They took my deposit, not because the place was a mess, it was to off set the difference of breaking the lease. My home was immaculate.

Emerald Green's managment team of Gulf Shores are not good business ethic people and do not know there job and nor do they understand RESPA. They have very little business skill sets. They are very insutling people and are horrible in customer relations.  Do not move into this place.  There are many people that have issues but cannot afford an attorney to deal with it. I could not afford an attorney and they took advantage of me.

name: Helena Aguilera
text: Don't move to Emerald Greens, do not buy or rent, they ONLY NICE to make you sign, once you since you better have money to pay attorneys, cuz Emerald Greens highly corrupted, and do not OBEY THE STATE LAW'S. Go to other resort's. Highly mean staff

name: Wire Guitar
text: Horrible staff. Unbelievably stressed environment. The horrible staff will ruin your vacation and your stay. They appear to be nice at first. But the next day they show lack of respect and care for . Emerald greens is not suitable for childeren, family's, pets, and seniors

name: Sawn Ray
text: Great condo, great price.  But owner had the cable coax laid on floor room to room.

name: la mitchell
text: Great place to stay but customer service is horrible. It seems when the oil spill happen they cared about the customer renting properites but since then they do not care. There is no willingness to assist anyone and it always seem like they are more worried about having fun then build repore with customer to build long relationships. I love the grounds but if you are looking for a place where they take care of things in your place when you need it .. this is not th eplace for you.

name: Donnie T
text:
* THIS WILL MOST LIKELY BE DELETED*
Unbelievably stressful environment. Very loud, with people, (vacationers and rude renters), running and riding bikes in the hallways. Staff is HORRIBLE! I need to say this again, STAFF IS HORRIBLE! This whole company is run terrible, from the top down.

If you have children, please be aware that the staff had tried to impose a, “curfew”, for the kids in the complex while we lived there.

There was also an incident where an employee that was drunk on the job, is a felon, and had warrants for his arrest WHILE WORKING AT THE COMPLEX, deliberately drove a John Deere Gator in to a group of children, including my son, injuring one child requiring transport to the hospital. Just Google, “emerald greens atv assault”, the story is on WKRG.
The BIGGEST thing about that whole situation is, not one person, NOT ONE, has asked if the kids are ok, no apology, ZIP. Even after several conversations in which I mentioned this, still no concern. When I mention that no one has asked about the well-being of the kids involved, I am told, “Okay”.

Most people I have talked with that live, or have lived there, it is usually for one year and out. This complex needs to train staff to care about the residents, and make up its mind as to what it will be. Owned, long term rental or vacation. All three together is a disaster!
Don’t let anyone say this is, "just a disgruntled former tenant”.
Am I disgruntled? Yes. Rightfully so? YES!
BEWARE BEWARE BEWARE!

name: Tammy Schneider
text: Friendly staff! On top of everything going on! Highly recommend!

name: GEORGIANA ENFELT
text: Checking on lodging,  looks very nice there.

name: Ryan Clark
text: I was in the employee for Emerald Greens and I was forced to quit by Miss shary and mr. Leon the old management company they were taken from my paycheck and I was forced to file a lawsuit against a company

name: Ray Reynolds
text: Great course

resp.text: Thanks for the wonderful feedback Ray! We hope you come out and play another round out on the course soon.

name: Bill M
text: WET!

resp.text: Hi Bill. Thank you for the feedback. We hope you come back out and give the course another try on a dry and beautiful day! If there is anything we can do to assist you regarding your experience, please don't hesitate to contact us at 251-968-3234.

name: Tyler Roberts
text: Have to be 16 to be in the pool but when I say I'm 16 all I get is a grumpy employee telling me to go get my parent if I want to swim

name: Tony Clark

text: DO NOT BUY OR RENT HERE! CARS GET BRUTALLY VANDALIZED AND NO ONE DO ANYTHING ABOUT IT, OR EVEN CARE! SECURITY HERE IS A FREAKING JOKE! GROUNDS ARE COVERED IN DOG POOP AND OWNER KEEP ADDING MONTHLY FEES, MANY ARE LEAVING AND SO I AM!
